From: Hendrik Tews <tews@os.inf.tu-dresden.de>
[My apologies if you see multiple copies of this call -- Hendrik Tews]

SSV 2011: Call for Participation

6th International Workshop on
Systems Software Verification (SSV'11)
Real Software, Real Problems, Real Solutions

August 26, 2011, Nijmegen, The Netherlands
https://es.fbk.eu/events/ssv2011/

............................................................................

SSV'11 is the 6th workshop in a series bringing together researchers and
developers from both academia and industry, who are facing real software
and real problems to find real, applicable solutions. This years workshop
is co-located with the 2nd International Conference on Interactive Theorem
Proving (ITP'11).

* Invited Talks *

  • Sebastien Bardin (CEA, France)
  • Bart Jacobs (Katholieke Universiteit Leuven, Belgium)
  • Peter Sewell (University of Cambridge, UK)

* Registration Deadlines *

  • Early registration (before July 15 2011), EUR 40
  • Late registration (after July 15 2011), EUR 50
    Please follow directions and links on the website.

* Location *

Hotel Erica in Berg en Dal (next to Nijmegen, the Netherlands)

* Program *

Invited Talks:

  • S. Bardin
    Refinement-based CFG Reconstruction from Executable Files

  • B. Jacobs
    VeriFast: A Powerful, Sound, Predictable, Fast Verifier for C and Java

  • P. Sewell
    Making Sense of Relaxed-Memory Concurrency

Regular Talks:

  • J. Brauer, R. R. Hansen, S. Kowalewski, K. G. Larsen and M. C. Olesen
    Adaptable Value-Set Analysis for Low-Level Code

  • D. Gueckel and S. Kowalewski
    Automatic Derivation of Abstract Semantics From Instruction Set Descriptions

  • H. Gast
    Structuring Interactive Correctness Proofs by Formalizing Coding Idioms

  • S. Berghofer
    Verification of Dependable Software using Spark and Isabelle

  • A. Jääskeläinen, M. Katara, S. Katz and H. Virtanen
    Verification of Safety-Critical Systems: A Case Study Report on Using Modern
    Model Checking Tools

  • J. O. Blech
    A Tool for the Certification of Sequential Function Charts based System
    Specifications

* Workshop Dinner *

The workshop will close with a dinner event. For planning the
workshop dinner and the number of printed proceedings, it would
be nice if you send a short email with the number of workshop and
dinner participants to hendrik@askra.de
